Utterance: Hi, Ellie!
Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How did it go with the writer’s group?
I went! I just observed, but it was really inspiring.
That’s wonderful! How did it feel to be there?
It felt good to be around other writers. I felt a bit nervous at first, but everyone was really welcoming.
That’s great to hear! Did you find anything in particular that sparked your creativity?
Yes! Listening to their stories made me think about my own experiences in a new light.
That’s fantastic! Have you started writing anything new since then?
I’ve started drafting a new piece based on some of the prompts they provided.
That’s excellent progress! How does it feel to be writing again?
It feels amazing! I forgot how much I enjoy it when I’m in the zone.
That’s wonderful to hear. What do you think helps you get into that “zone”?
Being in a quiet space with no distractions really helps. And sometimes listening to music.
Music can be a great motivator. What kind of music do you like to listen to while writing?
I like ambient or instrumental music. It helps me focus without the distraction of lyrics.
That’s a great choice! Have you set a goal for your writing this week?
I want to finish the first draft of that new piece by the end of the week.
That sounds like a challenging yet achievable goal. How will you hold yourself accountable?
I think I’ll share my progress with a friend who writes too.
That’s a great idea! Having someone to share your journey with can provide motivation.
Yes, I think it’ll help keep me on track.
How has your self-doubt been since we last spoke?
It’s still there sometimes, but I’ve been trying to reframe my thoughts like we discussed.
That’s a positive step. Have you noticed any changes in how you feel about your writing?
I think I’m starting to feel a bit more confident. I remind myself that it’s a process.
That’s a healthy perspective! Remember, every writer goes through ups and downs. It’s all part of the journey.
I appreciate that. I feel like I’m slowly learning to be kinder to myself.
That’s wonderful to hear! What else can you do to nurture that kindness towards yourself?
Maybe I can reward myself after I finish writing sessions, like treating myself to a nice coffee or something.
That’s a great idea! Positive reinforcement can be very effective.
I’ll definitely try that.
Also, how has your relationship with your family been lately?
It’s been good! I talked to my brother the other day, and we had a nice chat.
That’s lovely! Maintaining those connections is so important. How do you feel after talking to them?
I always feel supported and loved. It helps lift my spirits.
That’s a beautiful thing. Have you thought about visiting them soon?
I’m thinking about going back for the holidays! I can’t wait to see my niece.
That sounds like a wonderful plan. Family time can be so rejuvenating.
Yes, it really is. I feel so lucky to have them in my life.
You are lucky. Remember to cherish those moments. They can inspire your writing as well.
Absolutely! I often draw from my experiences with them in my stories.
That’s a great way to channel your emotions into your work.
I agree. It makes the writing feel more authentic.
Authenticity is key. As you continue to write, keep tapping into those personal experiences.
I will! Thank you for the encouragement.
You’re doing amazing work. I’m excited to hear about your progress next time.
Me too! I’ll keep you updated.
Until next time! Take care.
Bye, Ellie!
Bye!
